Exaggerate: The claim may be seen as exaggerating the beliefs of Marco Rubio and Rand Paul by stating that they believe the earth is 9,000 and 10,000 years old respectively.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the beliefs of Marco Rubio and Rand Paul on the age of the Earth and the extinction of dinosaurs are anti-science, which can be seen as a problematic assumption.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to back up the alleged beliefs of Marco Rubio and Rand Paul. The sources provided only mention their statements in relation to the age of the Earth, but not specifically about hunting dinosaurs to extinction or God removing dinosaurs.
Exist alternative explanation: There could be alternative explanations for the statements made by Marco Rubio and Rand Paul regarding the age of the Earth, such as theological debates or personal beliefs, which are not fully explored in the claim.
